title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: man in 30s dies in police pursuit near bradford .
tv producer admits child sex charges .
boy , 15 , arrested over school bomb hoax call .
york attack leaves man with serious injuries .
gas supplies returning to normal in north yorkshire .
development to help doncaster care leavers .
police puppy gets first job at lindholme prison .

documents.title: grandparent carers 'running up debts '
text: grandparent carers 'running up debts '

text: hart 'best place to live in uk '

text: councillor sorry for foodbank weight jibe

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: more money could be needed for fracking protests
text: north yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner has written to the government warning they may need more money to police anti-fracking protests .
latest figures show the force spent nearly £ 150,000 on the protests last month .
the cost of policing the anti-fracking protests at kirby misperton has now gone above £ 550,000 .
that 's for the last four months .
should it hit £ 1.4m , or 1 % of the force 's budget , they can then apply for financial help from the government .
in anticipation of that happening the county 's police and crime commissioner , julia mulligan , has now written to ministers .

documents.title: leeds-based paedophile-hunting group defends tactics
text: a paedophile-hunting group has defended its tactics after a television sports producer who was confronted when he travelled to the uk to meet what he thought was a 13-year-old girl admitted sex offences .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: sheffield students win gold in america with project
text: students from the university of sheffield have won an international engineering competition after their project , a plate reader which measures bacterial growth , impressed judges .
eight students from the faculties of engineering and science won gold at the international genetically engineered machine competition in boston
their project , a low cost plate reader created largely by a 3d printer , detects the number of bacteria in a solution by detecting the light passing through the suspension .
the less light that passes through the solution the more bacterial growth there has been .
the plate cost just £ 100 to produce - others can cost up to £ 10,000 .

documents.title: wakefield trinity sign versatile leigh centurions back
text: wakefield trinity have signed versatile back ryan hampshire for the 2018 season , following leigh 's relegation from super league last term .
hampshire , 22 , can play across the back-line and in the halves and has made 60 league appearances for wigan , castleford and the centurions .
his arrival follows the exit of half-back sam williams to nrl side canberra raiders in september .
`` it has taken some work to get there , '' head coach chris chester said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel update : m606 to remain closed through rush hour
text: the m606 looks set to be closed for a long while yet :
recovery and carriageway clean up work now complete .
we are currently inspecting the road surface for damage .
# m606 southbound fast slip to # m62 j26 westbound remains closed and will remain closed through the rush hour period .
slight delays currently .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leeds market goes for third late night opening
text: this thursday leeds ' kirkgate market will open its doors at night again , after a successful pilot in october .
thousands of people went to the first event , this week the council are promising a `` festive '' night time experience .
the events space and food hall section of the market will be opened up until 23:00 .
coun jonathan pryor said the night market is a great opportunity for visitors to discover some of the market 's popular traders whilst enjoying a night out with friends or family . ''

documents.title: travel update : very slow rush hour approaches
text: congestion across west and south yorkshire is looking like making the evening rush hour more like a crawl .
a reminder that the m606 is still closed following a fatal crash this morning .
in barnsley it 's causing problems for the buses :
in leeds , the outer ring road is looking busy :
accidents are n't helping either
65 bramley rtc on the a62 junction with asquith ave , buses are diverting street ln , gelderd rd , wakefield rd , bruntcliffe ln in both directions
# barnsbus the 226 service is currently running 20 mins late .
queuing traffic on the a6110 leeds outer ring road in beeston between the a58 whitehall road and the white rose centre .
# barnsbus the 16:15 218 from barnsley will be departing 15 mins late due to congestion sorry for the delay
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cancer information hub at sheffield 's moor market
text: a pilot scheme is under way to provide health information to visitors to sheffield 's moor market .
you might go to the market for your fruit and veg or to grab a bite to eat , but now information on cancer is available .
a pilot scheme is under way for 16 weeks to help direct people to services and advice .

documents.title: man visited crime scene in hire car
text: man visited crime scene in hire car

documents.title: 'distress ' over sheffield hoax bomb threat
text: more on the 15-year-old boy who has been arrested after a school in sheffield was evacuated because of a hoax bomb threat this morning .
more than 1,000 pupils were told to leave birley academy at about 09:40 as a `` precautionary measure '' while police searched the site .
the teenager is being held on sus of malicious communications - a charge which can carry a prison sentence .
ch supt natalie shaw said : after a prolonged search of birley academy , a device has not been found .
`` hoax calls are malicious and irresponsible , they can cause a considerable deal of distress . ''

documents.title: girl djs - the next generation
text: after 16 years experience of dj-ing at some of the best club nights in the uk , veteran dj miss melodie is training the next female dj generation .
after seeing a lack of female representation , miss melodie decided to set up her dj academy in leeds to help encourage more females to take part .
the academy was set up in 2007 , but her female-focused class has taken off in the last 18 months

documents.title: breakingboy , 15 , arrested over school bomb hoax call
text: a 15-year-old boy has been arrested today after a school was evacuated in response to a bomb threat at birley academy in sheffield .
the teenager has been arrested on sus of malicious communications and is currently in police custody .
the academy will be open as usual tomorrow and has released this statement :
statement following today 's incident : following notification of a bomb threat at birley academy this morning , we immediately implemented our robust and effective evacuation procedure .
in line with our school continuity plan and through constant liaison with the police 1/2
we took the necessary planned steps to ensure student and staff safety at all times .
we would like to thank everyone for ensuring our safeguarding practices were followed throughout .
will children be allowed to get in touch with their parents if they dont feel comfortable at school ?
hi , they 'll be able to speak to their ssc before school , at break or lunchtime if they still feel nervous .
we 'll do all we can to reassure them .
statement following today 's incident : following notification of a bomb threat at birley academy this morning , we immediately implemented our robust and effective evacuation procedure .
in line with our school continuity plan and through constant liaison with the police 1/2
we took the necessary planned steps to ensure student and staff safety at all times .
we would like to thank everyone for ensuring our safeguarding practices were followed throughout .
safety first .
well done to all not easy to deal with .
robust and effective ? ! ?
dont make me laugh everyone was screaming at us for panicking .
and also how was it a safety procedure ?
we had one of the teachers screaming at us and after people told us to leave they were screaming at us !

documents.title: travel update : problems in sheffield and rotherham
text: stagecoach says there are problems in both sheffield and rotherham this afternoon .
they highlight two services in sheffield as being particularly bad :
and in rotherham it 's a similar story :
we 're not sure why the traffic 's so bad currently , we 'll keep an eye on it and let you know if we find out :
# sheffbus service 25 currently experiencing very heavy delays
we will not be operating any services on new year 's day i 'm afraid .
yes first are running some services over the christmas and new year
we have no services but it maybe that first do you can find details on the website
wow ! !
shock will this service ever be reliable ?

it 's becoming an all to regular occurrence which then means some will terminate at city centre to then jump a few stops to get back on time which then means people can be stood 40mins waiting for a bus .
there is exceptionally heavy traffic at the moment - all vehicles are struggling down queen 's road , past heeley retail park and through woodseats .

or when it turns up the bus is rammer full and driver ca n't fit any more people on again resulting in people waiting longer this is a busy route so why are double decker not put on this route either ?
parts of the route are n't suitable for a double decker bus so we can not use them on the 25 service i 'm afraid .
we do all we can to keep the service running smoothly but the traffic is very bad this time of year .
# sheffbus service 88 experiencing heavy delays along ecclesall road into city , next few buses due to leave city towards ecclesfield expected to be 15-20 minutes late
# rothbus we are currently still experiencing long delays on all services that are going through parkgate .
we are trying to resolve the situation as soon as possible with minimum disruption possible
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: potash mine compensation plan agreed in north york moors
text: a detailed plan has been agreed by the north york moors national park authority on how it will spend more than £ 8m in order to offset the impact of the new potash mine near whitby .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: watch : 1,441 scarves knitted for north yorkshire
text: it 's emerged that 1,441 scarves have been knitted by bbc radio york listeners for the knit for north yorkshire campaign , smashing the target set of 1,000 .
i 've been to meet adam atkinson from the arc light hostel in york , to find out about what the impact of the campaign will be :
author: Joanita Musisi
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: police fears over missing man 's safety
text: police say they 're `` extremely concerned '' for the safety of a missing man from hull .
david ogden was last seen at about midday yesterday .
he 's said to be about 5ft 8ins tall , of slim build with fair hair .
police believe he has contacts in manchester , scarborough and sheffield .
anyone with information about mr ogden 's whereabouts is being asked to contact police .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: temperature rising over the next few days
text: disappointing if you were hoping for a white christmas , but good news if you were annoyed at de-icing your car :
our forecast shows things warming up considerably over the next few days and into christmas week .
daytime temps up to plus 8 .
a well earned rest for the gritting crews , enjoy and merry christmas all

documents.title: hoax call caused sheffield school evacuation
text: students at birley academy in sheffield were sent home today when the school was closed following what turned out to be a hoax call .
officers were alerted at 09:00 this morning and the college was evacuated as a precautionary measure
south yorkshire police say the person responsible could face a custodial sentence :
after a prolonged search of birley academy a device has not been found .
inquiries are ongoing to identify the caller .
hoax calls are malicious and irresponsible and anyone found to have made a hoax call could face a prison sentence ''

documents.title: travel update : crash between car and lorry closes a64
text: one of the main routes into scarborough is currently closed :
the closure is at this roundabout about six miles out of the seaside town :
the a64 at # staxton near # scarborough is currently closed due to a collision involving a car and hgv .
please avoid the area .
thank you .
@ twitterid
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: call for scrutiny of council 's contract with amey
text: there are fresh calls to open up sheffield council 's deal with tree replacement contractor amey for examination .
mps on the local government select committee say members on the scrutiny committee of any local authority should be allowed to see commercial contracts in full .
former lib dem leader on the council paul scriven , now lord scriven , explains why he considers this is important :

you ca n't make an informed decision about whether you are getting value for money if you do n't know the cost , you only know part of what is in the contract and that 's why it 's good councils should be able to see everything and ask broad questions ''

documents.title: number plates stolen from charity van
text: yorkshire cat rescue say they are `` concerned '' after the number plates on one of their vans have been stolen .
the keighley-based charity says they 're now worried that the plates could now be used on vehicles to commit crime .
sara atkinson from yorkshire cat rescue said `` it is a huge worry that our charity 's identity would be used for something so sinister , ''
she added `` any penalty notice or parking ticket issued to a car which is illegally using our plates , will be issued to yorkshire cat rescue and we 'll then have to prove that it was n't us . ''

documents.title: sheffield 's christmas musical gets great reviews
text: the wizard of oz maintains sheffield crucible 's tradition of hit productions of classic musicals at christmas .
the reviews are in for artistic director robert hasti 's first christmas production for the theatre and they are all glowing .
it gets five stars from the guardian and the observer and four from the telegraph and the times , with praise for gabrielle brooks as dorothy .

documents.title: kachunga out for up to three months
text: kachunga out for up to three months

documents.title: do you know this woman ? police want her
text: a woman standing in a queue to use a cash machine in scarborough is wanted by police following an apparent theft in the town .
police are appealing for information to help identify the woman in the cctv image .
at about 07.30 , the victim , a 74-year-old woman , was using the atm at the mccolls store on westwood , scarborough , but there appeared to be a fault with it .
the woman behind her was then heard to have said `` i 'm going to be late for work '' .
the 74-year-old victim then panicked and left the atm , believing it had n't worked .
but it had and £ 250 was dispensed as she walked away from the machine .
the woman behind the victim then went to use the atm machine , saw the victim 's cash and took it and left the store .

documents.title: police puppy gets first job at lindholme prison
text: a german shepherd puppy who is part of a south yorkshire police dog breeding programme is about to start her first role in service .
skye has been officially assigned to a handler working in the prison service at hmp lindholme .
she will work and train alongside prison service dogs to conduct searches , detect illegal substances and keep inmates safe .

documents.title: emily bronte celebrations to feature lily cole and maxine peake
text: a series of events celebrating the bicentenary of emily bronte 's birth have been announced .
the renowned wuthering heights author , born 30 july 1818 , was the third eldest of the family from west yorkshire .
model and actress lily cole has been given a role at the brontë parsonage museum , while events include a new exhibition featuring maxine peake .
the programme is part of a five-year celebration of the brontes .

documents.title: sheffield school evacuated after 'sus incident '
text: a school in sheffield was evacuated this morning after what police are describing as a sus incident .
birley academy , which has more than 1,000 secondary school age pupils , was evacuated at about 09:40 as a precautionary measure and police are still there .
the school said that `` it may be some time '' before staff and pupils are allowed back inside and asked parents not to contact the school .
it 's still unclear exactly what has happened at the school , the yorkshire post reported that parents said it was `` chaos '' as they arrived to their children up .
officers were called to birley academy in sheffield after police were alerted to a sus incident at 09:40 this morning .
the college chose to immediately evacuate students as a precautionary measure and officers remain at the scene . ''

documents.title: huddersfield striker out with medial ligament injury
text: huddersfield forward elias kachunga will be sidelined for up to three months with medial ligament damage .
the 25-year-old dr congo striker collided with watford keeper heurelho gomes during last weekend 's win at vicarage road and was carried off .
he opened the scoring in the match with his first goal of the season , but will be out for between eight and 12 weeks .
german-born kachunga was the club 's top scorer last term having joined from bundesliga side ingolstadt .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: neolithic timber trackway in doncaster protected by historic england
text: a neolithic trackway and platform at lindholme , doncaster has made it onto a list of the 20 most intriguing places given listed status in 2017 , drawn up by historic england .
it is a timber construction around 45 metres long which has been preserved in peat for more than 4,500 years and appears to have been used for ritual or community events .
exposed by mechanical peat cutting in the 1990s , the lindholme neolithic trackway and platform was first identified in 2004 and was investigated archaeologically in 2004-2006 .

also on the list , the gardens in skegness where billy butlin opened his first holiday camp , a working men 's club in eastbourne , mile markers on a b road in gloucestershire , and the gravestone of a warhorse in merseyside .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: two teens stabbed in huddersfield fight
text: two teenagers in huddersfield have been left with serious injuries after being stabbed during a fight yesterday - one is still in hospital .
it happened on church lane in the newsome area of the town at about 18:00 when police say they were called to a fight involving a group of people .
the two 16-year-olds were left with stab wounds and were taken to leeds general infirmary for treatment - one of them is still there in a stable condition .
a 16-year-old boy has been arrested in connection with the incident .

documents.title: urgent appeal for blood donors in sheffield
text: people with two valuable blood groups are being urged to donate at sheffield donor centre now .
nhs blood and transplant needs donors with b negative and o negative blood to donate after the bad weather hit blood collection .
donors with these groups will be able to walk in and donate at sheffield donor centre in church street .

documents.title: tv producer admits child sex charges
text: tv producer admits child sex charges

documents.title: man dies after motorway police pursuit
text: man dies after motorway police pursuit

documents.title: watch : one of the uk 's last remaining paternoster lifts at sheffield university
text: inside the landmark arts tower in sheffield , is an icon of design that 's rapidly becoming obsolete - one of the last remaining paternoster lifts in the uk .

built in the 1960s , the 38-carriage paternoster system which has no doors and moves continually without stopping at floor level , has served the building well for over six decades and is still going strong .
leicester university is closing its paternoster lift because replacement parts are no longer available :

documents.title: missing girl from malton found 'safe and well '
text: police in north yorkshire say they 've found a missing 12-year-old girl :
missing skye austin , 12 , from malton has been found safe and well .
thank you to everyone who shared our appeal .

documents.title: armed robbers steal cash from shop
text: armed robbers escaped with cash after raiding a shop near dewsbury yesterday .
three men went into the mccoll 's shop in gomersal at about 21:30 .
one of the men who was carrying a baseball bat threatened staff and demanded money from the till .
the men then left the shop with the money and police say they 're looking for three white men with local accents who were wearing hooded tops .

documents.title: man in 30s dead as car hits barriers in police pursuit
text: police say that a man in his 30s has died after a pursuit on the m606 near bradford in the early hours of this morning .
west yorkshire police say officers wanted to stop a silver audi a4 on stoney ridge road in the heaton area of bradford but the driver failed to stop for them at 02:45 .
they then followed the audi and it crashed into the barriers on the m606 , close to the junction of the m62 westbound - the driver of the car was pronounced dead at the scene .
the road is still closed as officers investigate and an immediate referral has been made to the independent police complaints commission .

documents.title: breakingman dies after police pursuit on m606
text: police have confirmed that a man has died after a police pursuit on the m606 near bradford this morning .
more to follow

documents.title: breakingsheffield school evacuated and pupils sent home
text: birley academy in sheffield has been evacuated and pupils sent home .
one parent has shared a text he received from the school this morning :
anyone with a child at birley academy , something has happened at school so kids are being sent home .
@ twitterid
any idea what ?
no , daughter called me , they were escorted out by police in small groups though .
trying to find out more .
@ twitterid @ twitterid do you know anything ?
birley academy - unfortunately there has been an incident at school today and the building has been evacuated .
it may be some time until we can return , students are being sent home , please collect them from birley lane main entrance if you are able to .
please do not call school
was that a text you received ?
yes it was

documents.title: warning over 'festive parties ' for young people in leeds
text: young people in leeds are being warned about the risks of party invites over the festive season .
the leeds safeguarding children board ( lscb ) is warning teenagers about the potential dangers of attending parties or `` get-togethers '' - especially on the promise of free drink and drugs .
they warn that the people behind child sex exploitation change their tactics regularly to `` avoid detection and prosecution '' .
lscb has issued this advice of when to be sus
although these parties or get-togethers can and do take place all year round , we know that there is an increase in this model of sexual exploitation at this time of year ''

documents.title: irish tv producer admits trying to meet leeds 'teenager '
text: an irish tv producer for rte has admitted sex offences after he was confronted by so-called paedophile hunters in leeds .
kieran creaven , 55 , is said to have flown from ireland to leeds to meet someone he believed to be a 13-year-old girl but was in fact a fake online identity .
he was charged with attempting to meet a child following grooming and attempting to cause or incite a child to engage in sexual activity between 1 july and 18 november .
creaven thought he was meeting the teenager at the queens hotel but was instead confronted by a vigilante group .
he was released on bail to be sentenced on 12 february .

documents.title: joe root on ashes defeat : 'i have to take responsibility '
text: england captain joe root has revealed his frustration at losing his first ashes series as skipper .
whittled out for 218 , england lost the third test in perth by an innings and 41 runs to hand the urn back to australia .
sheffield 's joe root has never won a test in australia and says it is bitterly disappointing :
you take a lot of responsibility as captain .
fair play to australia , they outplayed us in this game and won the key moments .
i am proud of the way we battled , but we were outskilled .
we have been in every game but not managed to drive it forwards .
we have n't been completely outplayed we just have n't performed at that level for long periods of time .
it 's hard to take but it 's part of cricket . ''

documents.title: breakingirish tv producer admits sex offences
text: a tv producer with irish broadcaster rte has admitted sex offences at leeds crown court .
he was confronted by so-called paedophile hunters when he travelled to the uk to meet what he thought was a 13-year-old girl .
more to follow .

documents.title: a 'sackful ' of santas on yorkshire 's best high street
text: is there a collective noun for a bunch of santas ?
a `` sack '' perhaps ?
it 's been a year since pateley bridge in north yorkshire won the title best high street in the village category of the great british high street awards .
what better way to unveil the winners plaque than to create a carnival atmosphere with 150 santas taking part !
the santa parade on saturday in the town raised £ 1,000 for the ripon based charity dementia forward .
if you have a better suggestion for the name of a group of father christmases , send them to us by clicking here .

documents.title: misconduct hearing over doncaster railway station incident
text: a british transport police officer is facing a gross misconduct hearing today , in relation to an incident at doncaster station .
the independent police complaints commission looked at the contact officers from british transport police had with a man at the station on 14 january 2017 .
the ipcc studied cctv of the incident and statements made by independent witnesses and the officers involved .
in the opinion of the ipcc investigator , there is evidence of a case to answer for gross misconduct for police constable robert mitchell in relation to the level of force used on the man .
the hearing in york is scheduled to last four days .

documents.title: york attack leaves man in serious condition
text: police say a man 's been left with serious head injuries after being attacked in york .
it happened on tanner row between midnight and 01:00 on sunday morning .
a man in his 20s was taken to hospital where he remains in a serious condition .
two men in their 20s have been arrested in connection with the incident .
one has been released under investigation while inquiries continue , the other remains in police custody .

documents.title: travel update : m606/m62 junction remains closed
text: the accident on the m606 looks likely to leave the m606/m62 junction closed for the rest of the morning :
and the earlier accident is having an obvious effect on public transport :
# m606 southbound has re-opened at j3 and j2 .
the fast slip from the m606 to the # m62 westbound at j26 remains closed and is unlikely to re-open before this afternoon .
traffic on the m606 wishing to join the m62 should utilise the roundabout .
220/221/222/229/254/255/268 services running up to 1hour 30mins late .
m62/m606 closed due to accident at jct 26
how long will buses take to arrive ?
been waiting an hour !
@ twitterid we are sorry we missed this jonathan - we do hope the bus arrived shortly after for you ?
^ma
still waiting
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cctv released after theft in armthorpe
text: officers investigating a reported theft of a mobile phone at the greggs store on church street , armthorpe , doncaster , at the beginning of december , have released cctv images in a bid to find the culprit .
at around 12:00 on friday 1 december , a mobile phone was stolen after being placed on the counter while a customer was buying food .
do you recognise this woman ?
police say if you have any information about the incident please report it via 101 quoting crime reference number a/158427/2017 .
anonymous information can also be given to crimestoppers via 0800 555 111 .

documents.title: 'tough decisions ' on special needs transport
text: young people in north yorkshire with disabilities or special needs , could lose their free `` home to school '' transport .
the county council is warning it may have to take what it describes as tough decisions because of `` long-term government austerity '' .
officials say unlike other authorities , north yorkshire 's managed to keep this service running despite cuts which began in 2010 .
they say cutting free transport for 16-year-olds and over with disabilities and special needs , would save £ 2m a year .
but it 's uncertain how many youngsters would be affected , or how they 'd get to school without help in england 's largest , most rural county .

documents.title: sheffield golden girl gets lifetime achievement award
text: former heptathlon champion dame jessica ennis-hill was honoured with the lifetime achievement award at the bbc 's sports personality awards .
the 31-year-old won olympic gold at london 2012 and a silver at the rio games four years later .
she retired in october 2016 as one of britain 's most successful athletes .

documents.title: in yorkshire stargazing brimham bonanza
text: how about this for a stargazing extravaganza ?
it was taken at brimham rocks , a collection of balancing rock formations in nidderdale .
if you 've taken any you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , just send them to us by clicking here .
author: Joanita Musisi
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: watch : yorkshire 's 'dry and bright ' weather
text: a decent start to the week this morning .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : new home for doncaster care leavers
text: a new development in doncaster aims to give young people who 've been in care most of their lives a stepping-stone to independence .

doncaster children 's trust is converting two houses in cantley , into a six-bed supported facility for care leavers , where they 'll get 24-hour support to help them transition to independent adult life .
currently , the trust relies on out-of-area placements , private supported accommodation providers and group living arrangements .
mica is a young adviser to the trust .
she 's been in care herself and says the house should help young people who are leaving care to become more settled :
renovating these properties into something fit for purpose for young care leavers will assist them in getting the skills needed to sustain their own tenancies in the future . ''

documents.title: travel update : m62 re-opens after 'serious collision '
text: things should start to move again on the m62 which has opened again after a 'serious collision ' earlier .
the m606 remains closed though :
# m62 westbound is now open within j26 following a closure for an on-going incident on the # m606 above .
the # m606 remains closed between j3 # bradford and the # m62 while police continue at scene .

documents.title: listen : 'rough edges ' - leeds ' kirkgate development
text: the redevelopment of leeds ' oldest area is set to continue , as more businesses look to relocate to kirkgate .
a marketing company is due to move into new york place , which is owned by leeds property company rushbond .
they 're also in the process of developing the corn exchange and white cloth hall .
martin hamilton , from the leeds civic trust , says whatever changes take place , it 's important the area retains its character :

documents.title: police search for a missing 12-year-old girl
text: police in north yorkshire are searching for a missing 12-year-girl .
skye austin ( from the malton area , has not been seen since leaving home at around 20:30 yesterday .
officers believe she is currently somewhere in the malton/norton area and say she may be wearing pyjamas .
she is described as white and of slim build .
police are are urging the public to report any possible sightings immediately .

documents.title: faster fingerprint gathering techniques for yorkshire
text: new forensic techniques that reduce the time taken to help process crime scene investigations have been introduced across yorkshire .
it relates to the gathering of evidence like fingerprints and footprints .
the project 's introduced the digital transmission of forensic evidence and means results are available to detectives almost immediately instead of taking days .

documents.title: check your rail journey this morning
text: if you 're catching a train this morning , you 'll be pleased to know everything seems to be running pretty much to time across yorkshire at the moment .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: yorkshire 's monday weather
text: after a cold and frosty start , it will be a dry day across the region with some good spells of sunshine .
staying dry overnight , but misty with some areas of low cloud , and with a few fog patches developing .
frosty in places by morning .

documents.title: revised trans-pennine tunnel to be shorter
text: revised proposals for a road tunnel between sheffield and manchester have been drawn up as part of a transport plan for the north .
the new trans-pennine tunnel would be shorter than the 20-miles currently proposed and include major upgrades to the a628 .
transport for the north ( tfn ) said the new route would also be cheaper to construct .
the revised idea will be presented to the government by the end of next year .
last year , the department for transport unveiled five possible routes for a multi-billion-pound tunnel to link the m60 motorway east of manchester to the m1 north of sheffield .

documents.title: north yorkshire 's three days without gas
text: more than 500 homes in north yorkshire are getting back to normal this morning after enduring a weekend of freezing temperatures without a gas supply .
a large gas leak in the helmsley , nawton and beadlam area caused the supply to go off on friday afternoon .
northern gas says its now managed to reconnect most of the homes , although last night around 90 were still without a supply .
supplies were lost to 600 properties in helmsley , nawton and beadlam on friday when the gas main `` collapsed '' at 16:00 during routine repair work .
engineers are expected to reconnect the remaining homes later .

documents.title: on the roads : m62 'serious collision '
text: there 'll be big hold-ups for commuters on the m62 this morning following a serious accident in the early hours near bradford .
it happened at the bottom of the m606 near bradford , which has been closed off southbound .
the m62 is closed westbound at junction 26 .
drivers are being urged to allow extra time to their journey to follow diversions .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on monday 18 december 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , travel , sport and weather updates from across yorkshire .
let 's start in a hopeful manner with a beautiful bbc weather watcher wakefield sunrise .
if you 've taken any you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , send them to us by clicking here .
